about_us.title: About us
about_us.text: We are a group of students from the University of Minho with a passion for motorsport. As the latest addition to the Formula Student scene in Portugal, we aim to deliver a project with a solid foundation and, in the short term, become a reference in the north of the country.

fs.title: Formula Student
fs.description: Formula Student is an international engineering competition that challenges university students to design, manufacture and compete with a racing car. The competition covers rigorous static and dynamic tests. Static tests include the team's business plan presentation, car production cost analysis and technical design evaluation. Dynamic tests assess the car's performance on the track, covering challenges such as skidpad, acceleration, autocross, endurance and efficiency. The scores obtained in these tests contribute to the calculation of the teams' overall score, thus determining the winners of each category.

classes.title: Formula Student Classes
classes.description: In Formula Student competitions there are three different classes

car.title: Building a Dream
car.description: Building a Formula Student car is about turning a project into reality. From the first sketch to the final adjustment, every step requires dedication and teamwork. With each assembled part, the dream becomes more tangible, and in the end, the finished car reflects the collective effort of transforming ideas into real performance.

team.title: Team
team.description: The team is currently organized into six sectors, each dedicated to a specific area of the car. Each sector is led by a Head and includes several members working together to develop the best car possible. Overall coordination is handled by the Team Leader, who oversees the work across all sectors. Additionally, we have two Technical Directors, each supervising the electrical and mechanical areas of the project.
team.management: The management sector handles the business side of the team. It is its responsibility to gather funds for the project via partnerships and also for its marketing. Management also has to fulfil the needs of the other departments. This includes ordering parts and tools or provide trainning sessions.
team.powertrain: The powertrain sector is responsible for the development of the power unit. It's the sector's duty to deliver a reliable and powerful electric motor. Efficiency is also key in this sector. The power unit needs to be tuned in such a way that it is always consuming the right amount of energy.
team.esw: As the name suggests, the electronics & software sector handles all the electronic components and software that keep the car safe and running smoothly. The sector makes sure all the major components of the car are properly programmed and communicating between each other.
team.drivetrain: The drivetrain sector focuses on delivering power from the engine to the wheels. It aims to achieve the most efficient power transfer in order to secure maximum acceleration and maintain speed for the full race distance.
team.chassiaero: The chassis and aerodynamics sector is responsible for designing and constructing the car's chassis. The chassis is the structure that supports all the car's components. Aerodynamics is responsible for minimizing air resistance and maximizing downforce.
team.suspension: The suspension & steering sector is essential for the car's performance. The suspension provides grip, stability, and absorbs track irregularities, while the steering allows the driver to control the car with precision.

invest.title: Invest in FSUMinho
invest.why-text: Supporting FSUMinho is far more than investing in a university team. It means associating your brand with the future of innovation, electric mobility and the academic talent that will shape tomorrow. For our partners, being with us means visibility in international competitions, coverage in the media and prominence on digital platforms. It also means social responsibility: supporting education, sustainability and the preparation of the next generation of leaders. It also offers networking opportunities, direct access to highly qualified talent and connections with other companies that share the same vision. At FSUMinho we do not simply ask for support for a project; we offer a partnership that creates value for both parties. Your contribution fuels our growth and, at the same time, is a strategic investment in your brand.
invest.monetary-text: Motorsport involves high costs, from car development to competitions. Financial support is key to managing expenses and achieving our goals.
invest.material-text: To turn the project into reality, we need materials, tools, infrastructure, software, and much more. This kind of support is crucial to take the car from modeling to the track.
invest.knowledge-text: Even with our experience, we are always eager to learn. Sharing knowledge with professionals is essential for our growth.
invest.website: Logo displayed in the sponsors' portfolio on the team's website
invest.banner: Logo displayed on the sponsors' banner
invest.kit: Logo displayed on the team's uniform worn during competitions
invest.rollout: Reference to the sponsor during the car's roll-out
invest.job-fair: Sponsor presence at the FSUMinho job fair
invest.cv: Access to a collection of CVs managed by the team
invest.open_days: Collaboration in organizing open days at the company
invest.uni: Company presence at other events at the University of Minho
invest.co-creation1: 1 annual post launched in collaboration between FSUMinho and the sponsor
invest.co-creation2: 2 annual posts launched in collaboration between FSUMinho and the sponsor
invest.co-creation3: 3 annual posts launched in collaboration between FSUMinho and the sponsor
invest.co-creation4: 4 annual posts launched in collaboration between FSUMinho and the sponsor
invest.events: Participation in events organized by the team

recruitment.title: Recruitment
recruitment.description: FSUMinho is looking for new members to join the team. If you are interested in being part of a challenging engineering project and working with a group of students passionate about motor sports, then FSUMinho is the right place for you. No matter your course or experience, if you have the willingness to learn and work as a team, then you are invited to join us.
recruitment.step1-summary: Fill out the form and submit your CV.
recruitment.step1-details: This is your first opportunity to show us who you are, what motivates you, and why you want to be part of FSUMinho.
recruitment.step2-summary: Introduce yourself and demonstrate your skills.
recruitment.step2-details: We will talk with you to get to know you better, and you will also receive a small technical challenge, tailored to the sector you chose.
recruitment.step3-summary: Show your impact in a team.
recruitment.step3-details: In this stage, you will collaborate with other candidates on a practical challenge, just like in our real projects.
recruitment.step4-details: You will enter an integration period where you will work side by side with experienced members to secure your place at FSUMinho.
recruitment.dates-text: The application process opens on September 12 and closes on September 20. The results of the pre-selection will be announced on September 22. Individual interviews will take place between September 23 and 27. The results of the individual interviews will be announced on September 29. The team challenge will be held on October 3. The final results will be released in the following days.
recruitment.mechanical-text: The sectors related to mechanics develop the car's chassis, suspension, steering, transmission, and aerodynamics. In Chassis and Aerodynamics, you'll design the car's structure, focusing on mechanical resistance, cockpit ergonomics, and system integration. In Suspension and Steering, you'll optimize suspension and steering systems, concentrating on geometry, kinematics, vehicle dynamics, and component design. The Drivetrain sector develops the kinematic chain for power transmission and battery cooling, working on speed, acceleration, fluid flow, and component dimensioning.
recruitment.electrical-text: The electronics sectors develop the car’s electrical systems, including the battery, motor, telemetry, and safety systems. In Powertrain, you'll work on high-voltage components and safety systems, focusing on hardware, programming, and documentation. In Electronics and software, you'll handle safety system simulation, sensor data, microcontroller programming, and telemetry, with roles in hardware testing, C programming, application development, and GitHub management.
recruitment.management-text: The management sector is responsible for team management, fundraising, partnerships, marketing, and communication, ensuring the team's efficiency and effectiveness. Partnership management establishes beneficial relationships with sponsors and suppliers. Marketing increases the team's visibility and reputation, while also conveying the team's values to the public and potential sponsors. These components work together to ensure the necessary resources and support to achieve the objectives.
recruitment.answer1: Any student enrolled in a bachelor's or master's degree at the University of Minho, regardless of the course, can apply to FSUMinho.
recruitment.answer2: Although prior experience is valued, it is not a requirement. FSUMinho is a learning project, and we are willing to teach and help all members develop their skills.
recruitment.question3: How much time do I need to dedicate to FSUMinho?
recruitment.answer3: It all depends on your level of involvement; however, we expect all members to be dedicated and committed to the project, given the demands of Formula Student.
recruitment.question4: Do I need to be fluent in English?
recruitment.answer4: Participation in competitions involves interacting with foreign judges, and all technical documentation is written in English. Being fluent is not a requirement, but it is something we value.
recruitment.answer5: Yes, we accept ERASMUS students. FSUMinho is an inclusive project, and we are open to receiving students of all nationalities. For these students, speaking Portuguese or English is a requirement.
recruitment.question6: Do you only accept students from Guimarães?
recruitment.answer6: No, we accept students from all campuses of the University of Minho. Most of our meetings are online to be more accessible to all members. However, part of our meetings are held in person in Guimarães.

talent.description: FSUM Talent Connect is the platform that brings FSUMinho’s partner companies closer to the academic community of the University of Minho. It features internship, project, and dissertation opportunities, fostering a direct connection between the industry and the university’s future engineers and professionals.

falperra.title: Falperra Hill Climb Poster
falperra.description: The Falperra International Hill Climb is one of the most prestigious and historic mountain races in Europe, attracting drivers and fans from around the world to the iconic curves of Braga, Portugal. To celebrate its 45th edition, we invite artists, designers, and motorsport enthusiasts to create the official event poster — a visual piece that captures the emotion, speed, and spirit of Falperra. Your design could become the image of an international motorsport legend. Let your creativity climb to the top!
falperra.participation0: Participants must be enrolled at the University of Minho;
falperra.participation1: Participation can be individual or in teams of up to 3 members;
falperra.participation2: Each participant or team may submit only one proposal;
falperra.participation3: The poster must be an original and unpublished creation and may not include elements protected by copyright;
falperra.participation4: The proposal must be created in vertical A3 format, with a minimum resolution of 300 dpi, and submitted in PDF, JPG, or PNG;
falperra.participation5: The file must not exceed 10 MB;
falperra.participation6: The logos provided in the ZIP file must be included at the bottom of the poster without any alteration;
falperra.participation7: The following information must be included on the poster:
falperra.participation-subitem4: Logo of Clube Automóvel do Minho (CAM) or a variant developed by the artists (e.g., all-white logo);
falperra.participation8: The cars of drivers Merli and Reto Meisel must also be included, and photos of them are available in a ZIP file on our website.
falperra.submission0: Proposals must be submitted between November 15, 2025, and January 5, 2026, to the email cartaz.fsuminho@gmail.com;
falperra.submission1: The email subject line must be: 'Falperra Poster Contest – [Team or Participant Name]';
falperra.submission-subitem1: Student ID number of each member;
falperra.submission-subitem3: Year of study of each member;
falperra.submission3: Proposals submitted outside the deadline or in a different format than requested will not be considered.
falperra.juri-description: Proposals will be evaluated by a jury composed of representatives from Clube Automóvel do Minho. The evaluation criteria will be as follows:
falperra.juri-item3: Relevance to the theme and event identity
falperra.prize-description: The following prizes will be awarded to the top three proposals:
falperra.prize0: 1st Prize – €300 and the opportunity to sign the official poster for the 45th Falperra International Hill Climb;
falperra.rights-description: By participating in the contest, the authors of the proposals authorize the organization to use, reproduce, and disseminate the submitted posters, in whole or in part, across all communication platforms associated with the event, with credit to the author, without additional payment beyond the awarded prize.
falperra.finals0: Participation in the contest implies full acceptance of these regulations;
falperra.finals1: The organization reserves the right not to award prizes if no proposal meets the minimum quality standards;
falperra.finals2: Any matters not covered in these regulations will be resolved by the contest organizers.
